Visiting Indian journalists experience DSS attractions in Dubai
The Media Centre of Dubai Festivals and Retail Establishment (DFRE), an agency of the Department of Tourism and Commerce Marketing (DTCM), hosted a group of top journalists from India as part of a familiarisation tour aimed at promoting Dubai as one of the favourite family tourism destinations in the world.
The group of visiting journalists representing top media organisations in India arrived in Dubai last week to experience many world-class attractions being offered in the city during the on-going 18th edition of Dubai Summer Surprises (DSS), which kicked off on 23 July and will run until 5 September under the theme “45 Days of Summer.”
As part of their three-day itinerary, journalists were taken on an exciting tour of Dubai that included a visit to the emirate’s iconic tourism spots, as well as a number of family-friendly events and attractions that make Dubai one of the most popular destinations in the world for visitors from around the world.
The group of journalists were put up at Radisson Blu Hotel – Dubai Deira Creek and their Dubai visit started on a high note against the panoramic backdrop of Dubai at the Burj Khalifa. Next, they enjoyed a trip to The Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo at The Dubai Mall followed by lunch at the popular Indian restaurant Junoon at Shangri-La Hotel.
During their time in Dubai, the Indian journalists also dropped by at Paris Gallery – a Strategic Partner of DFRE – where they had the opportunity to snap up exciting deals from DSS shopping promotions on a number of designer brands. They also visited crowd-favourite shopping destination City Centre Deira where they met with the mall’s Senior Manager – Majed Al Fahim.
A visit to the DFRE offices was also on the agenda – providing Indian journalists an insight into the backend operations that facilitate the smooth running of Dubai’s annual calendar of festivals.
The visiting journalists also toured the old Dubai area including key spots such as the Gold Souk. An exciting glimpse into the Emirati heritage and traditions at The Sheikh Mohammed Centre for Cultural Understanding (SMCCU) offered journalists a taste of the country’s culture and customs.
The media group was also hosted by Dubai’s ever smiling mascot Modhesh at his residence Modhesh World – one of the largest indoor edutainment destinations in the region – where they were treated to numerous attractions, activities and stage shows.
